title: Microsoft's stock surges as big earnings beat prompts analysts to boost price targets
text: Shares of Microsoft Corp. MSFT, +1.55% surged 1.3% in premarket trading Thursday, after the software giant's big earnings beat prompted bullish responses by Wall Street analysts. Of the 33 analysts surveyed by FactSet, 31 now have ratings of the equivalent of buy and two have the equivalent of hold ratings; no less than 10 of the bullish analysts raised their stock price targets. Wedbush's Dan Ives boosted his price target to $170, to match the highest on the Street, from $160, citing "robust" results that beat expectations "across the board." He reiterated his outperform rating. "This quarter was a major positive data point for [Microsoft] as well as overall cloud spending, which has been a concern among investors given some cracks in the armor of cloud plays such as Workday and ServiceNow and fears that IT spending is hitting a speed bump heading into 2020," Ives wrote in a note to clients. The stock has slipped 1.2% over the past three months, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.21% has eased 1.4%.
description: Shares of Microsoft Corp. surged 1.3% in premarket trading Thursday, after the software giant's big earnings beat prompted bullish responses by Wall Street...
